segment.source: The touch keyboard enables text entry for devices that support touch.
segment.target: The touch keyboard enables text entry for devices that support touch.

segment.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) text input controls invoke the touch keyboard by default when a user taps on an editable input field.
segment.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) text input controls invoke the touch keyboard by default when a user taps on an editable input field.

segment.source: The touch keyboard typically remains visible while the user navigates between controls in a form, but this behavior can vary based on the other control types within the form.
segment.target: The touch keyboard typically remains visible while the user navigates between controls in a form, but this behavior can vary based on the other control types within the form.

segment.source: To support corresponding touch keyboard behavior in a custom text input control that does not derive from a standard text input control, you must use the AutomationPeer class to expose your controls to Microsoft UI Automation and implement the correct UI Automation control patterns.
segment.target: To support corresponding touch keyboard behavior in a custom text input control that does not derive from a standard text input control, you must use the AutomationPeer class to expose your controls to Microsoft UI Automation and implement the correct UI Automation control patterns.

segment.source: See Keyboard accessibility and Custom automation peers.
segment.target: See Keyboard accessibility and Custom automation peers.

segment.source: Here are a few basic recommendations for custom text input controls.
segment.target: Here are a few basic recommendations for custom text input controls.

segment.source: Display the touch keyboard throughout the entire interaction with your form.
segment.target: Display the touch keyboard throughout the entire interaction with your form.

segment.source: Ensure that your custom controls have the appropriate UI Automation AutomationControlType for the keyboard to persist when focus moves from a text input field while in the context of text entry.
segment.target: Ensure that your custom controls have the appropriate UI Automation AutomationControlType for the keyboard to persist when focus moves from a text input field while in the context of text entry.

segment.source: For example, if you have a menu that's opened in the middle of a text-entry scenario, and you want the keyboard to persist, the menu must have the AutomationControlType of Menu.
segment.target: For example, if you have a menu that's opened in the middle of a text-entry scenario, and you want the keyboard to persist, the menu must have the AutomationControlType of Menu.

segment.source: Don't manipulate UI Automation properties to control the touch keyboard.
segment.target: Don't manipulate UI Automation properties to control the touch keyboard.

segment.source: Other accessibility tools rely on the accuracy of UI Automation properties.
segment.target: Other accessibility tools rely on the accuracy of UI Automation properties.

segment.source: Ensure that users can always see the input field that they're interacting with.
segment.target: Ensure that users can always see the input field that they're interacting with.

segment.source: Because the touch keyboard occludes a large portion of the screen, the UWP ensures that the input field with focus scrolls into view as a user navigates through the controls on the form, including controls that are not currently in view.
segment.target: Because the touch keyboard occludes a large portion of the screen, the UWP ensures that the input field with focus scrolls into view as a user navigates through the controls on the form, including controls that are not currently in view.

segment.source: When customizing your UI, provide similar behavior on the appearance of the touch keyboard by handling the Showing and Hiding events exposed by the InputPane object.
segment.target: When customizing your UI, provide similar behavior on the appearance of the touch keyboard by handling the Showing and Hiding events exposed by the InputPane object.
